column1: 3.4.3.4	  Summary of evidence and recommendations for the diagnostic evaluation of uncomplicated cystitis

Do not screen or treat asymptomatic bacteriuria in the following conditions:  •   women without risk factors;  •   patients with well-regulated diabetes mellitus;  •   post-menopausal women;  •   elderly institutionalised patients;  •   patients with dysfunctional and/or reconstructed lower urinary tracts;  •   patients with renal transplants;  •   patients prior to arthroplasty surgeries;  •   patients with recurrent urinary tract infections.
Screen for and treat asymptomatic bacteriuria prior to urological procedures breaching the   mucosa.
Screen for and treat asymptomatic bacteriuria in pregnant women with standard short   course treatment.
